column5: SHANGHAI  Oct 10 Ford Motor Co said on Friday it expects to boost sales in China once new assembly facilities come online and new vehicles hit showrooms in coming months  after posting its first dip in China monthly sales this year.

column4: Ford says Sept China auto sales dipped 0.2 pct y/y
column5: SHANGHAI  Oct 10 Ford Motor Co and its Chinese joint ventures sold 95 875 vehicles in China in September  edging down 0.2 percent from 96 111 vehicles in the same period a year earlier.

column4: GE unit in talks to buy Milestone Aviation: WSJ
column5: General Electric Co's  finance arm is in talks to buy Milestone Aviation Group Ltd  as the U.S. conglomerate looks to expand its aircraft-leasing operation into helicopters  The Wall Street Journal reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: GM says Sept China auto sales up 15.2 percent year-on-year
column5: SHANGHAI General Motors Co  and its Chinese joint ventures sold 319 936 vehicles in China in September  up 15.2 percent from a year earlier  the U.S. automaker said on Friday.

column4: GM says Sept China auto sales up 15.2 pct y/y
column5: SHANGHAI  Oct 10 General Motors Co and its Chinese joint ventures sold 319 936 vehicles in China in September  up 15.2 percent from a year earlier  the U.S. automaker said on Friday.

column4: Mali health workers get experimental GSK vaccine in Ebola trials
column5: BAMAKO Healthcare workers in Mali have been given an experimental Ebola vaccine as part of the first human trials of the shot in West Africa  where three nations are battling the worst outbreak on record.

column4: Mali health workers get experimental GSK vaccine in Ebola trials
column5: BAMAKO  Oct 10 Healthcare workers in Mali have been given an experimental Ebola vaccine as part of the first human trials of the shot in West Africa  where three nations are battling the worst outbreak on record.

column4: UPDATE 3-Symantec to split into two companies focused on security  storage
column5: Oct 9 Norton antivirus software maker Symantec Corp will split into two publicly traded companies  one focused on security and the other storage and backup  potentially making itself more attractive to suitors.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Infosys sees future in new tech; investors cheer strategy shift
column5: * Q2 net profit at 30.96 bln rupees vs 29.20 bln estimates

column4: Infosys posts higher-than-expected second-quarter profit; keeps annual sales growth outlook
column5: BANGALORE Infosys Ltd   India's second-largest IT services exporter  said on Friday its second-quarter net profit grew by a higher-than-expected 28.6 percent on higher sales  an increase that would help it meet its annual sales growth forecast.

column4: Infosys Q2 net profit up 28.6 pct  beats forecasts
column5: BANGALORE  Oct 10 Infosys Ltd  India's second-largest IT services exporter  said on Friday its second quarter net profit rose 28.6 percent  beating analysts' estimates.

column4: BRIEF-SFL announces openning of first Indigo hotel from Intercontinental Hotels Group in France
column5: * Announces the opening of the first Indigo hotel from Intercontinental Hotels Group in France in the Carre Edouard VII site in Paris  Source text for Eikon:  Further company coverage:    (Gdynia Newsroom: +48 58 698 39 20; Gdynia.newsroom@thomsonreuters.com)

column4: U.S. tech sales warnings knock Alcatel  Infineon shares
column5: PARIS Shares in telecom gear maker Alcatel-Lucent  fell 7 percent on Friday  extending a recent slump  after U.S. rival Juniper Networks Inc  became the latest technology company to issue a warning on sales.

column4: Defense supplier L-3 concludes review of aerospace systems business
column5: Oct 10 L-3 Communications Holdings Inc  said an internal review of its aerospace systems business found no material misstatements of its previous financial statements  sending its shares up as much as 13.5 percent in late afternoon trading.

column4: UPDATE 1-Market Chatter-Corporate finance press digest
column5: Oct 10 The following corporate finance-related stories were reported by media:

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-U.S. Air Force probed for scrapping costly planes bought for Afghans
column5: (In story published Oct 9  corrects aircraft name in second paragraph to C-27A  from C-27J)

column4: Morgan Stanley says 'no assurance' Rosneft deal will close
column5: NEW YORK Morgan Stanley said on Friday that there is "no assurance" a deal to sell its physical oil trading business to Russian oil company Rosneft will close.

column4: Newmont to pursue support for Peru gold project despite election
column5: LIMA  Oct 10 Newmont Mining Corp's  Peruvian unit said on Friday that it will keep pushing for local support for its stalled gold mine in the highland region of Cajamarca after a jailed opponent of the project was easily re-elected to lead the region.

column4: Orange weighs IPO of Africa  Mideast units
column5: PARIS French telecom operator Orange  is studying whether to float its African and Middle Eastern units as a way to raise money to cut debt and reinvest in Europe  the company said on Friday.

column4: Orange weighs IPO of Africa  Mideast units
column5: PARIS  Oct 10 French telecom operator Orange  is studying whether to float its African and Middle Eastern units as a way to raise money to cut debt and reinvest in Europe  the company said on Friday.

column4: Reliance seeks sale of Eagle Ford stake for up to $4.5 billion: sources
column5: NEW YORK India's Reliance Industries Ltd  is seeking a buyer for its stake in the Eagle Ford Basin oil and natural gas joint venture with Pioneer Natural Resources Co   a sale that could raise up to $4.5 billion  according to people familiar with the matter.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: (Adds Darden Restaurants  Fidelity  Lanco Infratech  Twenty-First Century Fox  Reliance Industries  Unicredit and Tieto)

column4: Reliance seeks sale of Eagle Ford stake for up to $4.5 billion: sources
column5: NEW YORK India's Reliance Industries Ltd  is seeking a buyer for its stake in the Eagle Ford Basin oil and natural gas joint venture with Pioneer Natural Resources Co   a sale that could raise up to $4.5 billion  according to people familiar with the matter.

column4: Games-Rio incentive for boxers  wrestlers at European Games
column5: LONDON  Oct 10 The inaugural European Games in Baku  Azerbaijan next year will offer qualification opportunities for the 2016 Olympics to boxers and wrestlers  organisers announced on Friday.

column4: U.S. judge hits RBC with $76 million in damages tied to Rural/Metro deal
column5: A Delaware judge said Royal Bank of Canada  must pay $75.8 million in damages to former shareholders of Rural/Metro because it failed to disclose conflicts of interest that tainted the $438 million buyout of the ambulance operator.

column4: U.S. judge hits RBC with $76 mln in damages tied to Rural/Metro deal
column5: Oct 10 A Delaware judge said Royal Bank of Canada must pay $75.8 million in damages to former shareholders of Rural/Metro because it failed to disclose conflicts of interest that tainted the $438 million buyout of the ambulance operator.

column4: SAP chief says business never been stronger
column5: FRANKFURT Business at German business software maker SAP  has never been stronger  its chief executive told Reuters Insider television on Friday. | Video

column4: Giacometti 'Chariot' on view at $800 million Sotheby's show
column5: LONDON A sculpture of a goddess riding a chariot and a limestone bust of a woman's head upon which the sculptor Modigliani used to light candles are the centerpieces of an eye-popping 500 million pounds ($800 million) of art put on show at Sotheby's on Friday.

column4: Giacometti "Chariot" on view at $800 million Sotheby's show
column5: * Stone for Modigliani was scavenged from Paris Metro site

column4: Blackstone partners with Taubman in advisory unit spinoff
column5: Blackstone Group LP said it would spin off its M&A  restructuring and private equity fundraising advisory businesses to avoid conflicts  combining them with the advisory firm of Morgan Stanley investment banking veteran Paul Taubman. | Video

column4: Telecom Italia chairman says no joint project with Mediaset
column5: MILAN Telecom Italia  Chairman Giuseppe Recchi said on Friday the phone group was not working on any joint project with Mediaset   rejecting a press report it could look at acquiring the broadcaster's pay-TV business.

column4: Telecom Italia chairman says no joint project with Mediaset
column5: MILAN  Oct 10 Telecom Italia Chairman Giuseppe Recchi said on Friday the phone group was not working on any joint project with Mediaset  rejecting a press report it could look at acquiring the broadcaster's pay-TV business.

column4: Blackstone partners with Taubman in advisory unit spinoff
column5: Blackstone Group LP said it would spin off its M&A  restructuring and private equity fundraising advisory businesses to avoid conflicts  combining them with the advisory firm of Morgan Stanley investment banking veteran Paul Taubman. | Video

column4: UPDATE 4-Blackstone gives up its roots in advisory unit spin-off
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 10 Blackstone Group LP said on Friday it would spin off its advisory units into a company headed by star Wall Street investment banker Paul Taubman  to avoid potential conflicts of interest in the sprawling private equity empire.

column4: Blackstone to spin off financial advisory business
column5: Oct 10 Blackstone Group LP said it would spin off its financial and strategic advisory services business  its restructuring advisory business  and its Park Hill fund placement business and  combine them with financial advisory firm PJT Partners.

column4: CEO Bewkes needs to show Time Warner better alone than with Murdoch
column5: NEW YORK Ten years ago  Walt Disney Co  having fended off a hostile bid from Comcast  had to make a case why it was better off as an independent company.

column4: Toronto-Dominion Bank executive charged for role in $1 billion scheme
column5: MIAMI A former Toronto-Dominion Bank executive was charged in south Florida federal court with six counts wire fraud and conspiracy to commit wire fraud in connection with a $1 billion Florida Ponzi scheme on Friday  according to court documents.

column4: CORRECTED-Toronto-Dominion Bank executive charged for role in $1 billion scheme
column5: (Corrects figure in 2nd paragraph to $1.5 million from $1.25 million and removes extraneous "a")

column4: Regulators approve TransCanada's 900 000 bpd oil sands pipeline
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Oct 10 Canadian regulators have approved TransCanada Corp's 900 000-barrel-per-day Grand Rapids pipeline to carry diluted bitumen from Fort MacKay in the oil sands of northern Alberta to the marketing and transportation hub of Edmonton  Alberta.

column4: BRIEF-CMVM says rejects UnitedHealth Group Inc. offer for Espirito Santo Health Care
column5: * UnitedHealth Group Inc. offer to Espirito Santo Health Care Investments SA rejected on Thursday by the regulator - CMVM

column4: Lower US gas price could pump up Wal-Mart  other discount chains
column5: Oct 10 Lower gasoline prices are expected to fuel higher retail sales this winter  especially at Wal-Mart Stores and other chains that cater to low- to middle-income shoppers  analysts said.

column4: 'Guardians of the Galaxy' head to Disney XD TV in animated show
column5: LOS ANGELES The misfit "Guardians of the Galaxy" super heroes are headed to television in a new animated series  Walt Disney Co's children's TV network said on Friday  after they saved the universe from destruction in the summer's biggest movie.

column4: MOVES-Wells Fargo appoints four senior credit officers
column5: Oct 10 Financial services company Wells Fargo & Co announced the appointment of four commercial banking leaders as part its attempts to improve the credit experience for its customers.
